contents.value:
The HTTP client provides the capability for initiating contact with a remote HTTP service. The API it
provides includes functions for the standard HTTP methods, forwarding a received request and sending requests
using custom HTTP verbs.  
  
---  
  
### Fields  
  
`string` ***url*** : Target service url  
  
---  
  
### Methods  
  
+ `remote function post(string path, module1:RequestMessage message, string targetType) returns module1:Response`  
The `Client.post()` function can be used to send HTTP POST requests to HTTP endpoints.  
  
+ `resource function post path1/[string id1]/path2/[string... ids] (string str, string... ids2) returns module1:Response`  
Sample resource method.  
  
+ `remote function get(string path, module1:TargetType targetType) returns targetType|module1:ClientError`  
Sample remote method with java interoperability  
  
+ `remote function forward(string path, handle request, module1:TargetType targetType) returns targetType`  
Sample remote method with java interoperability  
  
+ `remote function delete(module1:TargetType2 targetType) returns targetType`  
Sample remote method with java interoperability  
  
+ `resource function get path3 (module1:TargetType targetType) returns targetType|module1:ClientError`  
Sample resource function with java interoperability  
  
+ `resource function get path4/[string pathParam] (module1:TargetType targetType) returns targetType|json|module1:ClientError|error`  
Sample resource function with multiple target types with java interoperability  
  
  
---  
  
[View API Docs](https://lib.ballerina.io/ballerina/module1/0.1.0#Client)
